data.event: Granted in 1753 by the Masonian Proprietors, the town was named for Alexandria, Virginia, location of a 1755 conference of governors early in the French and Indian War.

event.title: was named for Alexandria, Virginia, location of a 1755

data.event: Granted in 1753 by the Masonian Proprietors, the town was named for Alexandria, Virginia, location of a 1755 conference of governors early in the French and Indian War.

event.title: was granted to Joseph Butterfield and others, 13 March 1757

data.event: Alexandria was granted to Joseph Butterfield and others, 13 March 1757.
First settled in 1769 by John Moore Corliss and his brother Jonathan, it was incorporated by the General Court on 23 November 1782.

event.title: was incorporated by the General Court on 23 November 1782

data.event: First settled in 1769 by John Moore Corliss and his brother Jonathan, it was incorporated by the General Court on 23 November 1782.
Danbury was set off and incorporated in 1795.
